C

calls(String, String, String) - Method in class debug.Verbose
Display and log a message with additionnal informations in the log file The message is displayed and logged if and only if the verbose level is equal to 5

Width of the character's image (fixed)
CliOptions - Class in debug
Class used to analyze the commands passed to the program For now, only the verbose "-v" can be passed to the program (once or several times) You can set a level of verbose mode from 0 to 5, you just have to put -v for verbose mode level 1, -vv for level 2 and so on
CliOptions(String[]) - Constructor for class debug.CliOptions
Constructor of the CliOption
critical(String, String, String) - Method in class debug.Verbose
Display and log a message with additionnal informations in the log file The message is displayed and logged if and only if the verbose level is greater or equal to 1

Main function of the A3P program You can set options like verbose mode to the program
map - Variable in class world.World
Two-dimensional array containing all objects within the world This object is filled using a file in the root directory and in the form of map[x][y] from top-left to right-bottom

Slowly move the character to a certain point regarding his current position

S

Scenery - Class in world
Class used to handle any world object The Scenery class is used to handle the objects that are displayed in the graphical game world.
Scenery(String, int, int) - Constructor for class world.Scenery
Scenery class constructor with height and width as parameters
Scenery(String) - Constructor for class world.Scenery
Scenery class constructor with no optional parameters
Scenery(String, int, int, int, int) - Constructor for class world.Scenery
Scenery class constructor with height, width, x shifting and y shifting as parameters
serious(String, String, String) - Method in class debug.Verbose
Display and log a message with additionnal informations in the log file The message is displayed and logged if and only if the verbose level is greater or equal to 2

V

Verbose - Class in debug
Class used to display and log messages all over this program
Verbose(int) - Constructor for class debug.Verbose
Class constructor
verboseLevel - Variable in class debug.CliOptions
Level of verbosing detected due to the args passed to the program
verboseMode - Variable in class debug.Verbose
Level of verbosing, from 0 to 5 The number of information displayed and logged goes increasingly as the number increase - Level 1 : Only critical errors and exeptions are displayed on the console - Level 2 : Serious but not critical errors and level 1 displayed - Level 3 : Warning and level 2 displayed - Level 4 : Informations and level 3 displayed - Level 5 : Everything, included Class instanciations and function calls and level 4 displayed
visible - Variable in class world.characters.Character
Boolean equals to true if the character is visible, false if the character is not
visible - Variable in class world.Scenery
Boolean equals to true if the scenery is visible, false if the scenery is not
visible - Variable in class world.World
Boolean equals to true if the world is visible, false is the world is not

W

width - Variable in class world.Scenery
Image width
window - package window
 
Window - Class in window
 
Window() - Constructor for class window.Window
Constructor of the Window class
world - package world
 
World - Class in world
World is a class used to handle the game world graphics The World class use the Scenery objects (or the objects implementing the Scenery class) to display images of several objects corresponding to trees and traps and so on
World(String) - Constructor for class world.World
World class constructor
world.characters - package world.characters
